programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Two college professors and a law student take on The Beast.

programme.title: #Xmas
programme.desc: Interior designer Jen aims to win a social media contest for a design brand by posing as an influencer with her best friend playing her husband and her nephew as her baby. When she is selected as a finalist, Jen is torn about whether to keep up the lie or reveal the truth.

programme.title: Christmas at Castle Hart
programme.desc: An American woman in Ireland in search of her Irish roots meets an Earl and is mistakenly hired to host his castle's epic Christmas party.

programme.title: The Christmas Cure
programme.desc: An ER doctor returns home for Christmas and learns that her father has decided to retire. As she spends time working at his clinic and reuniting with her high-school sweetheart, her renewed bonds lead her to consider making a big change in her life.

programme.title: Christmas with the Darlings
programme.desc: When an assistant gives her final notice, she is drawn into helping the charming, younger brother of her wealthy boss as he looks after his orphaned nieces and nephew through Christmas.

programme.title: A Kiss Before Christmas
programme.desc: Ethan, always the nice guy, wakes up in a new reality at Christmas. Initially, he is enthralled with his new life but soon realizes that it's not what he thought it would be.

programme.title: Royal Christmas
programme.desc: A prince posing as a commoner reveals the truth about his royal lineage to his fiancée, who then must try to impress her disapproving future mother-in-law when the couple travel to his castle to spend the holidays with his family.

programme.title: Christmas Next Door
programme.desc: An author of bachelor lifestyle books is left in charge of his young niece and nephew for the holidays.

programme.title: On the 12th Date of Christmas
programme.desc: Two co-workers vying for the same promotion are tasked to create a 12 Days of Christmas scavenger hunt to promote the premiere of a new hotel.

programme.title: A Tale of Two Christmases
programme.desc: Some holiday magic causes Emma to have two very different Christmas experiences. In one, she returns home to meet an old friend. In the other, she spends time in the city with her crush.

programme.title: Haul Out the Holly
programme.desc: Emily visits her parents for the holidays, but she soon learns that she will be holidaying alone. However, she is soon urged to participate in the local Christmas festivities.

programme.title: A Christmas Cookie Catastrophe
programme.desc: As the newly-appointed CEO of a noteworthy cookie company, Annie contends with a setback when the company's flagship recipe is stolen. She then connects with a humble local baker to reimagine the recipe and save her company.

programme.title: A Holiday Spectacular
programme.desc: Maggie heads to NYC in 1958 to dance with the Rockettes.

programme.title: A Royal Corgi Christmas
programme.desc: Prince Edmond plans to win his mother over with the gift of a cute but out-of-control corgi. He turns to American dog trainer Cecily to help get the pup ready for the Christmas Ball.

programme.title: The Nine Kittens of Christmas
programme.desc: Zachary and Marilee are thrown back together at Christmas when they're tasked with finding homes for a litter of adorable kittens.

programme.title: Christmas at the Plaza
programme.desc: When historian Jessica is hired to create The Plaza's Christmas display, she finds more than facts while teaming up with handsome decorator Nick to bring the display to life.

programme.title: Christmas Waltz
programme.desc: A dance instructor helps Avery face her fears in life and fulfill her dream of learning to dance.

programme.title: Boyfriends of Christmas Past
programme.desc: Marketing professional Lauren decides to give romance a second chance after an unexpected encounter with four of her ex-boyfriends, who encourage her to pursue her longtime friend, Nate.

programme.title: In Merry Measure
programme.desc: Singer Darcy returns home to celebrate Christmas with her family. She soon finds herself coaching the high school rival alongside her former enemy, Adam.

programme.title: A Timeless Christmas
programme.desc: Charles Whitley travels from 1903 to 2020 where he meets Megan Turner and experiences a 21st Century Christmas.

programme.title: A Christmas Tree Grows in Colorado
programme.desc: Erin is planning the town's Christmas celebration and must win over firefighter Kevin in order to obtain his beautiful spruce for the tree lighting.

programme.title: Sense, Sensibility & Snowmen
programme.desc: Christmas enthusiast party planners, Ella and her sister Marianne, clash with client Edward, a not so jolly toy company CEO.

programme.title: A Christmas Treasure
programme.desc: Aspiring writer Lou must make a significant choice about her future career after she opens an antique time capsule and finds herself falling for a kind-hearted chef.

programme.title: A Cozy Christmas Inn
programme.desc: Real estate exec, Erika, travels to Alaska during the holidays to acquire a B&B, only to discover it's owned by her ex. Soon she is falling in love with the town and quite possibly him.

programme.title: When I Think of Christmas
programme.desc: A young woman returns to her hometown over the holidays to help her mother pack up her home yet unexpectedly reconnects with a past lover.

programme.title: Christmas Made to Order
programme.desc: Steven recruits Gretchen to bring the holiday joy to his family.

programme.title: Coyote Creek Christmas
programme.desc: An event planner begins to believe in the Christmas spirit after encountering a handsome guest at her family's inn during an internationally-inspired Christmas celebration.

programme.title: Christmas Sail
programme.desc: Liz receives a call for help from her estranged and ailing father to return home for the holidays. Liz then resolves to create a whimsical Christmas celebration for her young daughter as she encounters a familiar face on the downtown streets.

programme.title: A Cheerful Christmas
programme.desc: As a 'Christmas Coach,' Lauren provides her clients with their most magical Christmas ever. But to do that, she must get her new clients' son, Lord James, to open up about their holiday traditions.

programme.title: My Christmas Dream
programme.desc: A woman wants a promotion to her company's Paris location, so she makes promises to her boss about creative holiday displays. Struggling to make good on these promises, she seeks help from a recently fired single dad who has artistic talent.

programme.title: Three Wise Men and a Baby
programme.desc: Three brothers find their holiday plans upended when they must work together to care for an infant.

programme.title: Ghosts of Christmas Always
programme.desc: Katherine is a Ghost of Christmas Present and she must help one soul, Peter, rediscover his Christmas spirit. But this year has something unusual in store.

programme.title: Christmas Getaway
programme.desc: Hoping to spend the holiday relaxing, a travel writer takes a traditional Christmas vacation for the first time. Through a mix up on the rental site, she finds herself double-booked for the holidays with a widower, his young daughter and mom. What begins as an inconvenience blossoms into much more.

programme.title: Heart of the Holidays
programme.desc: Career-driven Sam returns to her hometown for the holidays where she runs into her high school boyfriend, Noah. Together they rediscover what matters most in life.

programme.title: We Wish You a Married Christmas
programme.desc: A couple goes to a quiet town to reconnect at Christmas on the advice of their marriage coach.

programme.title: The White Lotus
programme.desc: A whole new cast of hotel guests arrive at the White Lotus in Sicily.

programme.title: King Richard
programme.desc: Family man Richard Williams recognizes the athletic prowess brimming in his daughters Venus and Serena, inspiring him to develop an unorthodox training plan to propel the girls to international recognition as Black female tennis aces. Based on a true story.

programme.title: Avenue 5
programme.desc: Five months after failing to redirect the ship's course,

programme.title: The Vow
programme.desc: After Keith's abuses of Dani's sister "Cami" are detailed through disturbing text messages, Keith's trial ends with a guilty verdict. As NXIVM's critics rejoice, Keith's remaining supporters regroup. After "Cami" and others give victim impact statements, Keith is sentenced to 120 years. Following the trial, Nancy examines her role as she awaits her own sentencing.

programme.title: Hellboy
programme.desc: Ron Perlman gives a helluva performance as a quick-witted demon-turned-superhero in this entertaining adaptation of Mike Mignola's comic book. Here, he helps a secret U.S. government agency battle modern-day Nazis and interdimensional monsters. Guillermo del Toro ("Blade II") directed and wrote the script.

programme.title: COVID Diaries NYC
programme.desc: A compilation of five short films chronicling the lives of five young filmmakers, ranging in age from 17 to 21, who turn their cameras on themselves to tell the stories of their families during the first wave of the COVID-19 pandemic in New York City in 2020. The films illuminate the plight of essential workers and their families during the early days of the crisis as they navigate the deadly virus and a country riven by social upheaval.

programme.title: Robin Hood
programme.desc: Robin of Loxley is a ravaged veteran trained from the ground-up by his Moorish commander Little John to become the legendary Robin Hood. Together they mount a rebellion against the English monarchy and topple the corrupt Sheriff of Nottingham and his powerful army.

programme.title: The Fast History Of
programme.desc: The incredible full story of Nike, from their early days selling Japanese sneakers from the trunk of a car. Their highs and lows, how air tech came to be, a look behind the brand's most iconic campaigns and how taking a crazy chance on a rookie turned Nike into the 33 Billion dollar empire they are today.

programme.title: The Fast History Of
programme.desc: The superstore-sized history of Walmart. Since its founding in 1962, Walmart has grown from a humble discount store in rural Arkansas to the largest company in the world. With over 11,000 locations, they employ more people than the U.S. Armed Forces. Walmart averages a profit of $1.8 million dollars, every hour.

programme.title: The Fast History Of
programme.desc: Jack Daniel's, the most popular whiskey in the world, has been making their unique blend since 1866. But the story of how a couple of backwoods bootleggers invented Tennessee whiskey is full of unexpected turns. Like the secrets behind their unique recipe, how they barely survived prohibition, the endorsement that created a national shortage and how Hollywood ran away with the brand's image.

programme.title: The Food That Built America

programme.title: The Food That Built America
programme.desc: Small town farmer Orville Redenbacher has a lifelong dream of creating the perfect popcorn kernel, leading to the first significant development of popcorn in thousands of years which he sells nationwide, eventually pitting him against industry rivals for supremacy of America's oldest snack.

programme.title: The Food That Built America
programme.desc: After a bakery owner's death, his wife takes the reigns and grows it into a national powerhouse. Meanwhile, a married couple have bankrupted one bakery, but are determined to succeed their second time around and conquer the baking world with a revolutionary way to sell snack cakes.

programme.title: The Food That Built America

programme.title: The Food That Built America

programme.title: The Food That Built America

programme.title: The Food That Built America

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: According to the Greek philosopher Plato, the lost continent of Atlantis was once home to an advanced civilization before it was destroyed in a cataclysm. For centuries, archaeologists have tried to uncover evidence to prove that this legend is true.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: A house that narrowly dodges the path of a tornado. Rain that falls from the sky like blood. And lightning that follows one into their home. The world is full of strange and mysterious weather phenomenon that still have no explanation. Is it a result of just simple scientific anomalies, or could there be a stranger, more spiritual force at work.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: From ancient civilizations to 20th-century empires, mankind has had an inexplicable fascination with preserving the dead. It is discussed why.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: A look at animals that have extraordinary powers, including a dog that can detect cancer faster than doctors and a horse that can read minds.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: The possibility that the mind and body can use the power of ritual to tap into hidden forces that lie just beyond the grasp of conventional explanation is investigated. Ancient practices such as prayer, blood sports, voodoo and exorcism are often thought to be relics of bygone superstition, but there is evidence they have an impact on the physical world.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: The Great Flood. The Plagues of Egypt. Sodom and Gomorrah. Moses Parting the Red Sea. Examining if these were merely tall tales, or could they be historically accurate. And, if so, if they were just freak occurrences or Acts of God.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: On March 11th, 2020, the World Health Organization declared the outbreak of the Coronavirus had become a worldwide pandemic. Some of the most devastating plagues in human history are examined, as well the scientific advances to combat these diseases, including the development of Edward Jenner's vaccine for smallpox in the 1790s.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: A look into how psychopathic serial killers can be capable of committing horrific atrocities.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Looking into the facts and secrets about the moon.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Researchers and experiencers around the world are convinced that the so-called "Bigfoot" exists, often pointing to the discovery of large, inexplicable footprints as evidence.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Laura Dern guest stars as the new U.S. Poet Laureate, but in the main story, Bartlet fires the first shot of his reelection campaign when he calls his likely GOP foe less than brilliant at the end of a local-TV interview, and the national press just can't get enough of it. The White House response: a "nonapology apology" from C.J. and a promotion for conservative staffer Ainsley Hayes (Emily Procter). Meanwhile, it seems that there's a Web site devoted to "all things Josh."

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The Vice President (Tim Matheson) makes a surprise announcement, and might be in for a surprise (except that he's not surprised when he hears it). Meanwhile, a truck carrying depleted uranium-fuel rods crashes in Idaho, and terrorism isn't ruled out; a Cabinet secretary wants to make an announcement without clearing it with Toby; Donna wants Josh to see about a Presidential pardon for her favorite high-school teacher; and Bartlet helps Charlie with his tax return.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: A documentary in which former real-life West Wingers (including Presidents Clinton, Carter and Ford) recall White House experiences also includes clips from series episodes. Oscar-winning producer Bill Couturie ("Common Threads: Stories from the Quilt") is the director. Also interviewed: Henry Kissinger; former Presidential adviser David Gergen; former White House chief of staff Leon Panetta; and former White House press secretary Dee Dee Myers, a writer for "The West Wing."

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: After criticizing Saudi Arabia, C.J. receives many negative e-mails, one of which interests the Secret Service. Meanwhile, the President is to meet with the new Russian President, and as Sam irons out summit details with Russian negotiators, Joint Chiefs chairman Fitzwallace arrives with sobering news: The Russians are building a nuclear facility in Iran that can produce plutonium. Also, a computer-chip maker who's a campaign contributor announces that his company must recall 80 million chips.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: While C.J. (code name: "Flamingo") gets used to being tailed by Special Agent Donovan (Mark Harmon), the President must deal with a terrorist threat on a military installation. Meanwhile, the networks are threatening to cut coverage of the upcoming conventions; Sam receives a copy of a TV commercial attacking the President; and Josh, back from the Helsinki summit, gives Donna a box of cured moose meat. It turns out to be even more unappetizing that it appears. Bruno Gianelli: Ron Silver.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: While Bartlet, Leo and Fitzwallace (John Amos) grapple with terrorism and "moral absolutes," Josh and Amy (Mary-Louise Parker) grapple with each other over a welfare-reform bill. Meanwhile, Donna represents the White House at a North Dakota state-party caucus; Toby doesn't want the President to go to a New York fund-raiser because Gov. Ritchie will be there; Charlie is tasked with finding candidates to replace Mrs. Landingham; and C.J. discovers that Simon Donovan is a very straight shooter.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: The Qumari defense minister, who's secretly a terrorist mastermind, is arriving in the U.S., and Leo and Fitz want him killed. Bartlet wonders: Is it legal? Is it right? Meanwhile, Toby and Leo play a dirty trick on Gov. Ritchie; C.J. and Simon Donovan come to an understanding of sorts; and Charlie recommends a woman to be Bartlet's new secretary.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: As Josh reluctantly begins addressing a group of high-school high achievers the White House goes into a lockdown. No one can leave and the kids have questions. "So what bothers them about us?" asks one, assuming that Arab terrorism is the reason for the lockdown. Meanwhile, an Arab-American junior staffer (Ajay Naidu) is arrested---in his office---on suspicion of being involved with a terrorist plot.

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Part 1 (of two). A "day-in-the-life" episode about a very long day for Toby, Josh and Donna, who are stranded in Indiana when the Presidential motorcade leaves without them after a campaign speech. At the White House, Sam fills in for Josh as the President's "wide-angle lens." Meanwhile, Abbey starts a firestorm when she calls herself "just a wife and mother"; the Qumaris make noise about their missing Defense Minister; and the Dow keeps dropping.

programme.title: Time for Him to Come Home for Christmas
programme.desc: Elizabeth receives an unusual voicemail from a stranger pleading to his love for a second chance, inspiring an unusual chain of events in the days leading up to Christmas.

programme.title: Hope at Christmas
programme.desc: A teacher tries to make Christmas extra special for Sydney and her young daughter.

programme.title: A Christmas Melody
programme.desc: A single mom closes her store and returns to her hometown with her young daughter, and the two struggle to fit in, especially when the mom encounters her old high-school rival. However, things improve when a music teacher helps the daughter write a song for the Christmas variety show.

programme.title: The Christmas Note
programme.desc: A widowed mom strikes up a reluctant friendship with her new aloof neighbor, who just learned she has a long-lost sibling. As they embark on a quest to find this sibling, the two women begin to feel less lonely.

programme.title: Karen Kingsbury's Maggie's Christmas Miracle

programme.sub-title: The One with the Red Sweater

Tag: Eddie Cahill. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston. Chandler: Matthew Perry. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Baby Shower
programme.desc: Monica incurs the wrath of Mrs. Green (Marlo Thomas) by forgetting to invite her to Rachel's baby shower, where the mom-to-be begins to see that she may not be ready for motherhood after all. Meanwhile, Ross and Chandler help Joey prep for an audition to host the world's worst game show. Katherine: Adria Tennor. Ray: Jonathan Nichols. Joey: Matt LeBlanc.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey sets Phoebe up with a stranger (Paul Rudd) to score a date with one of her friends; Rachel catches Ross visiting his pediatrician from childhood; and a job offer stands between Monica and Chandler's relocation to Tulsa. Sally: Elaine Hendrix. Dr. Gettleman: Gregory White. Mary Ellen: Dedee Pfeiffer.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel has an unsettling dream involving Joey. (Or is it his soap character, Drake?) Ross fills in for Monica on Chandler's weekend getaway. (He's not a cheap date.) And Phoebe, guitar in hand, camps out in front of Monica's restaurant. (Monica isn't amused.)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Soap Opera Party
programme.desc: Joey's soap-star-studded party helps Rachel forget about getting romantic with her roomie, who catches the eye---and maybe more---of Ross's newest love interest (Aisha Tyler). Meanwhile, Chandler endures the attacks of a man-hater (Alex Borstein) during a wild one-woman show. Daytime actors Matthew Ashford and Kyle Lowder appear in cameos. Dirk: Ethan Erickson.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Fertility Test
programme.desc: Rachel runs into a familiar face during her free massage from one of Phoebe's corporate-chain foes, while the Bings try to run away from a frightening face at their doctor's office. Meanwhile, Ross tutors Joey on the ways to win over a brainiac like Charlie (Aisha Tyler), who may have her mind set on another man. Janice: Maggie Wheeler. Nurse: Myra Turley.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Chandler eyes up---and picks out---a coworker (John Stamos) who could be the prime sperm donor for him and Monica; Phoebe runs into an ex (Hank Azaria) en route to a party where she plans to spite Mike; Rachel buddies up to Charlie after opening her big mouth about Joey; and Ross secures a speaking gig in the tropics.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Conclusion. A rainy trip to the tropics pits Monica against Mike in a ping-pong showdown, and puts Joey in line to break Rachel's heart and bust Ross in a very compromising position. Charlie: Aisha Tyler. Mike: Paul Rudd.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Is Fine
programme.desc: Ross's bogus reaction to Joey and Rachel's romance leads to a disastrous dinner date with them, a confused Charlie and too many margaritas. Meanwhile, Chandler slips up in front of a couple's adopted son; and Frank Jr. (Giovanni Ribisi) returns to ask Phoebe a very important---and inappropriate---favor. Charlie: Aisha Tyler. Owen: Daryl Sabara. Colleen: Kelly Waymire.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The return of their cloying old chum (Jennifer Coolidge) pits Monica against Phoebe; Joey and Rachel have a hard time getting romantic with one another; and a series of tanning-salon snafus leads to a Ross of a different color.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Emma's first birthday goes from cute to criminal after Rachel realizes that her bunny-shaped cake would feel more at home at a bachelorette party. Teaming up with her alternate lives, the unlikely allies realize that they alone possess the power to protect the world from calamity, plunging them into the midst of an outlandish quest.

programme.title: Confess, Fletch
programme.desc: Confess, Fletch is a reboot of the classic crime-comedy film. This time, Fletch becomes the main suspect in a series of murders while investigating thieves that stole his girlfriend's art collection. To exonerate himself, Fletch begins his own investigation into the murders and discovers a lot of people could be the guilty party, including his art collecting girlfriend.

programme.title: The L Word: Generation Q
programme.desc: Bette and Tina are having a hard time making peace with their past and future selves; Angie gets a shock on her first day in college; Shane adjust to living with Tess; Alice wonders about what she wants in a partner; Finley is back from rehab and work on getting back to the life she had with Sophie.

programme.title: Ziwe
programme.desc: Ziwe explores the male psyche with Michael Che then challenges the patriarchy with Julia Fox. Featuring iconic guests Benito Skinner, Michael Antonucci, George Civeris, Sam Taggart and Ronald Metellus with music by Ziwe and Jen Goma.

programme.title: Let the Right One In
programme.desc: The mystery of Eleanor's origin story as a vampire is revealed.

programme.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once
programme.desc: Grappling with the onset of middle age, a Chinese immigrant discovers that she can traverse across time and space. Teaming up with her alternate lives, the unlikely allies realize that they alone possess the power to protect the world from calamity, plunging them into the midst of an outlandish quest.

programme.title: Swiss Army Man
programme.desc: A man stranded alone on a deserted island makes one last attempt at escape after a dead body washes up on shore. The talking corpse provides the castaway with a number of unexpected tools, which he'll need if he wants to be reunited with his love.

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: In this exciting thriller based on the hit '80s TV series, an ex-Black Ops agent emerges from self-imposed retirement and decides to help the downtrodden after he saves a young woman from vicious Russian gangsters.

programme.title: Step Up
programme.desc: Sage gets out of jail and is set to reclaim his spot at the tour; Rigo's pressured to put out a new material as he prepares for his last performance at Chicago; Poppy and Collette get into an argument about Rigo.

programme.title: Setup
programme.desc: When one thief betrays another by taking off with stolen goods, the betrayed man teams up with a dangerous mob boss to seek revenge.

programme.title: The BMF Documentary: Blowing Money Fast
programme.desc: Meech and BMF gains unwanted attention following a shooting at a nightclub in Atlanta; law enforcements focus on important evidence to build a case against BMF.

programme.title: Black Friday
programme.desc: The daily shift begins like any other for a cohort of employees at a local toy store. However, their intertwined fates take an inexplicable and unusual turn after the shoppers entering their store seem possessed by an unsettling plague. With the customers descending en masse, the employees risk their lives to combat the mounting infection while remaining loyal to one another.

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: Tim Allen, Sigourney Weaver and Alan Rickman star in this clever spoof of TV science-fiction. At a sci-fi convention, the cast from the canceled series "Galaxy Quest" is approached by a group of extraterrestrials who ask them to help with a raging war back home. Tony Shalhoub, Daryl Mitchell.

programme.title: Get Him to the Greek
programme.desc: In this uproarious buddy comedy, an intern is forced to follow rowdy rock star Aldous Snow on a trip from London to a concert in Los Angeles meant to revive his stalled career. Their trip is further complicated when Snow's arrival coincides with that of a gorgeous model-singer.

programme.title: Power Book III: Raising Kanan
programme.desc: Kanan returns to Queens where Raq is trying to mend the many fractures in the Thomas family. As Raq expands her empire, Kanan doubts his future in the drug game. Meanwhile, Detective Howard is released from the hospital.

programme.title: Power Book III: Raising Kanan
programme.desc: Raq learns she may have a snitch and tasks Marvin with confirming the rumor. Lou brings in a potential new artist, but he and Crown disagree. Kanan helps Famous sell mix tapes. Jukebox tracks down her estranged mother.

programme.title: Power Book III: Raising Kanan
programme.desc: A surprise encounter with Howard leaves Kanan rattled. Raq tries to expand into new territory, but when an associate and valuables go missing, she is reunited with an old adversary. Lou continues to butt heads with Crown.

programme.title: Power Book III: Raising Kanan
programme.desc: Jukebox and Kanan look for answers in family matters. When Raq's push into another territory is stalled, she proposes a meeting.

programme.title: Power Book III: Raising Kanan
programme.desc: Raq focuses on mother-son bonding with Kanan in the Catskills, but they're interrupted when business follows them. Crown disrespects Lou, bringing their simmering beef to a boil. Burke digs into Howard's personal life.

programme.title: Power Book III: Raising Kanan
programme.desc: Raq assures everyone they need to follow orders and keep working as planned. Kanan takes on more responsibility but things go wrong when he runs into neighborhood kids. Lou feels the pressure in his partnership with Crown.

programme.title: Power Book III: Raising Kanan
programme.desc: Raq searches for a new home, Lou finds himself on the other side of his partner's unpaid debts, and Burke gains traction in her investigation on Howard.

programme.title: Power Book III: Raising Kanan
programme.sub-title: A House Is Not A Home
programme.desc: The rift between Raq and Kanan grows and Kanan seeks comfort elsewhere. Marvin lays low, waiting for the consequences of his actions to blow over. Raq sees dark clouds on the horizon.

programme.title: Power Book III: Raising Kanan
programme.desc: With his living situation threatened, Famous reaches out to Lou as a last-ditch effort. Meanwhile, Raq receives a new business proposal and must eliminate a threat, and Burke closes in on what really happened in Baisley Park.

programme.title: Power Book III: Raising Kanan
programme.desc: Decidedly his own man, Kanan strays further from his mother and sets up shop on his own on the corners of South Jamaica. Worried about retaliation, Raq questions Unique. Lou's rift with Raq grows when he makes a discovery.

programme.desc: Camille's revenge mission leads her to Valmont as he embarks on his most challenging seduction yet.

programme.desc: This Best Picture winner charts 24 hours in the lives of guests at a plush Berlin hostelry, where a down-on-his-luck thief covets a ballerina's pearls, while lusting after the mistress of a businessman whose dying bookkeeper is tended by a drunken doctor.

programme.title: Johnny Belinda
programme.desc: Jane Wyman won an Oscar for her portrayal of a deaf woman living a hardscrabble life in a Nova Scotia fishing village, where she is taught to communicate by a young doctor. Later, she is raped by a local lout, and charged when he is later found murdered. The film was nominated for 12 Oscars, including Best Picture, Director (Jean Negulesco) and Actor (Lew Ayres), but Wyman's was the only win.

programme.title: Death of a Cyclist
programme.desc: Study in human relationships, involving a hit-and-run accident that has unexpected repercussions. Lucia Bose, Alberto Closas. Miguel: Otello Toso. Rafa: Carlos Casaravilla. Matilde: Bruna Corra.

programme.title: Only Angels Have Wings
programme.desc: Heroics for a rickety Andes airline spark this exciting tale. Cary Grant, Jean Arthur. Bat: Richard Barthelmess. Judith: Rita Hayworth. Kid: Thomas Mitchell. Dutchman: Sig Ruman. Sparks: Victor Kilian. Gent: John Carroll. Les: Allyn Joslyn. Tex: Donald Barry. Joe: Noah Beery Jr. All very familiar but extremely well done.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: An orphan boy runs away from the workhouse to London and falls in with a gang of thieves working for a master thief.

programme.title: Kiss Me Kate
programme.desc: A pair of divorced actors come together to star in a musical stage adaptation of Shakespeare's "The Taming of the Shrew," and soon find their feelings resembling those of the characters.

programme.title: Annie Hall
programme.desc: Woody Allen cowrote and directed this Best Picture, and stars as a neurotic Jewish comedian and writer recounting the roller-coaster relationship he had with a kooky, WASPish aspiring singer. The film employs fantasy flashbacks, direct-to-camera monologues, subtitles and even a cartoon sequence to tell its tale.

programme.title: Super Size Me
programme.desc: This acclaimed documentary follows filmmaker Morgan Spurlock as he performs a gutsy experiment: He eats nothing but fast food for a month. It doesn't turn out to be the healthiest diet, but the film certainly gives one food for thought. Also covered are school-lunch programs; the impact of food-industry lobbyists; and America's skyrocketing obesity rate.

programme.title: Brokeback Mountain
programme.desc: Three Oscars---for score, Larry McMurtry and Diana Ossana's script and Ang Lee's brilliant direction---went to this heartbreaking and powerful yarn about a long-running, forbidden affair between two gay cowboys (Heath Ledger, Jake Gyllenhaal). Michelle Williams and Anne Hathaway play their wives. The screenplay was based on a 12-page magazine story by E. Annie Proulx. Randy Quaid, Linda Cardellini, Anna Faris.

programme.title: Leap Year
programme.desc: The heir to a fortune unwittingly causes trouble when he starts giving relationship advice to his female friends. Roscoe "Fatty" Arbuckle, Mary Thurman. James Cruze directed.

programme.title: Solaris
programme.desc: A widowed psychologist is sent to a space station orbiting a water-dominated planet called Solaris to investigate the mysterious death of a doctor, as well as the mental problems plaguing the dwindling number of cosmonauts on the station.

programme.title: Mgm Parade Show
programme.desc: MGM stars are interviewed.

programme.title: The Gold Rush
programme.desc: Pathos, tenderness, slapstick---Charles Chaplin mines them all in this silent classic set in turn-of-the-century Alaska, where he's a would-be prospector. Among the comic gems: Chaplin, near starvation, eating a meal of boiled boots and spaghetti-like shoelaces; and trying to keep his balance in a cabin atop a cliff.

programme.title: Snowed Under
programme.desc: A writer's-blocked playwright goes to a cabin to finish his play, only to find a sexy blond neighbor and two ex-wives showing up at his door.

programme.title: Winter Meeting
programme.desc: Bette Davis as a lonely woman drawn to a returning war hero. James Davis, John Hoyt, Janis Paige. Mrs. Castle: Florence Bates. Castle: Walter Baldwin. Bretaigne Windust directed.

programme.title: On Dangerous Ground
programme.desc: A hardened police officer agrees to help the sister of a killer when she realizes the victim's father hopes to get revenge by murdering the perpetrator, who is deeply mentally ill.

programme.title: I Know Where I'm Going
programme.desc: En route to a loveless marriage, a woman's outlook is changed when she's stranded on a Scottish isle. Wendy Hiller, Roger Livesey, Pamela Brown. Ruairidh Mor: Finlay Currie. Cheril: Petula Clark. Hunter: Walter Hudd. Robinson: Valentine Dyall. Charming romance.

programme.title: Desire Me
programme.desc: A man befriends a fellow soldier at a German prison camp during WWII. After the friend dies, the man falls in love with his widow.

programme.title: The Enchanted Cottage
programme.desc: A scarred World War II veteran and a plain young woman discover true love, beauty and a magical transformation for both after moving into a small house on a sprawling estate. A remake of a 1924 silent melodrama based on a play by Arthur Wing Pinero.

programme.title: Random Harvest
programme.desc: After losing his memory, a World War I vet starts a new life with a showgirl. But their happiness is threatened when an accident restores his former memories -- and his former life.

programme.title: Trapeze
programme.desc: A crippled acrobat mentors a protégé, but a beautiful new female performer comes between them.

programme.title: Birdman of Alcatraz
programme.desc: Docudrama about Robert Stroud, the prisoner who became an ornithologist and author. Based on actual events.

programme.title: Brute Force
programme.desc: Archetypal prison-break picture, with Hume Cronyn's memorably sadistic warden. Burt Lancaster, Charles Bickford, Howard Duff, Sam Levene, Jeff Corey, Art Smith, Roman Bohnen, John Hoyt, Yvonne DeCarlo, Ann Blyth, Ella Raines. Mark Hellinger produced. Richard Brooks scripted. Jules Dassin directed.

programme.title: Seven Days in May
programme.desc: Military brass conspire at top levels to overthrow the president, but a whistleblowing colonel uncovers the coup. Written by Rod Serling of "Twilight Zone" fame.

programme.title: Lancaster
programme.desc: A documentary exploring the Lancaster, an iconic British bomber. The Lancaster is renowned for flying the most dangerous missions during WWII.

programme.title: Montana Belle
programme.desc: A romantiicized fictionalization of Belle Starr, an infamous female outlaw who lived in the late 19th century.

programme.title: Westward the Women
programme.desc: A frontiersman in 1851 is hired by a California settler to lead a wagon train full of mail-order brides from Chicago to the West Coast. Along the way, they face treacherous elements, Indian attacks and other assorted mishaps.

programme.title: Gypsy Colt
programme.desc: In the throes of a drought, farmer parents of a girl may have to sell her horse to pay their bills.

programme.title: Wine, Women and Horses
programme.desc: A racing fan is handicapped by a respectable wife.

programme.title: The Story of Seabiscuit
programme.desc: A fictionalized account of legendary racehorse Seabiscuit's career is run around a romance involving the niece of the horse's trainer who falls in love with the jockey who rides it. Footage of two of Seabiscuit's races is interspersed.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: A fictionalized account of "Little Sure Shot" recounts how she was raised in the hills of Ohio and found success in Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show.

programme.title: Blood on the Moon
programme.desc: An itinerant cowhand finds himself in the middle of a feud between homesteaders and cattlemen, and does what he can to settle it.

programme.title: Annie Get Your Gun
programme.desc: An adaptation of the Irving Berlin Broadway hit musical about legendary Wild West sharpshooter Annie Oakley, who rose from backwoods gamin to the uppermost rungs of international stardom. An Oscar winner for Best Musical Score.

programme.desc: Lacey grew to over 600 lbs on pizza and ice cream, and knows Dr. Nowzaradan is her only hope. She must rally her divorced parents around her for support and find a way to control her moods that won't include binge-eating.

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Sam and Dean must stop Rowena, who is on a deadly mission. Meanwhile, Castiel looks to heaven to recruit angels for an impending invasion but is shocked by not only what he finds, but who.
